title: Robinhood Stock Drops After SEC Chairman Warns on Order Practice
summary: Shares of the retail brokerage fell nearly 7% after Gary Gensler signaled he was open to banning the practice. Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc. tumbled on Monday after the head of the Securities and Exchange Commission signaled that he was open to banning payment for order flow, a practice that accounts for most of the online brokerage's revenues.

title: U.S. Hate Crimes Rose in 2020 on Racially Motivated Incidents
summary: Bias-driven attacks against Asian, Black and white people fueled overall increase, FBI data show, as episodes targeting Jews and Muslims fell. Hate crimes in the U.S. rose about 6% last year, fueled by an increase in anti-Asian, anti-Black and antiwhite incidents, according to FBI statistics released Monday, reaching levels not seen in more than a decade.

title: The Covid Civil-Rights Mask
summary: The Department of Education elbows into another cultural battle.. The Office for Civil Rights in Education is an arm of the administrative state that has often inflamed the culture wars in the last decade. So it was only a matter of time before it jumped into America's latest, bitter cultural conflict on the progressive side. On Monday the agency targeted states that have limited the ability of local school districts to compel students to wear masks.

title: Zoom Hits $1 Billion in Quarterly Revenue, but Shows Signs of Easing Growth
summary: Company raises full-year guidance, reports more than half a million customers with more than 10 employees. Zoom Video Communications Inc.'s quarterly revenue surpassed $1 billion for the first time in the company's history, though the strong demand for its videoconferencing services that made it ubiquitous during the pandemic is showing signs of easing as regular activities resume.

title: Hurricane Ida's Climate Resilience Lesson
summary: Spending to protect against extreme weather beats green boondoggles.. The pictures of Hurricane Ida's wreckage across Louisiana are grim, and the storm isn't over. But the good news is that New Orleans appears to have weathered the tempest as well as could be expected thanks to its post-Katrina flood-protection investments. This is a reminder of how hardening infrastructure against unpredictable Mother Nature pays off.

title: Last Flight From Kabul
summary: A day that will live in infamy as thousands are left behind.. The last American troops left Kabul on Monday-before the Aug. 31 deadline as the Taliban and President Biden had insisted-ending a 20-year conflict but also diminishing the hope of escape for tens of thousands of Afghan interpreters and others who helped America. The frantic evacuation flights managed to get many out, but this was a shameful day in American history, no matter how much the White House wants to spin it otherwise.

title: Bernie Sanders Runs Out of Billionaires
summary: Spending plans: $4.5 trillion. Billionaire net worth: $4.4 trillion.. Bernie Sanders held a rally in Iowa over the weekend to sell his $3.5 trillion budget proposal, and he also had kind words for President Biden's $1 trillion infrastructure plan. As usual, Mr. Sanders assailed America's "billionaire class," which he said is refusing to pay its "fair share" of taxes.

title: Education Department to Investigate Five States That Ban Mask Mandates in Schools
summary: U.S. education secretary says bans may violate the civil rights of students with disabilities; states could face financial sanctions. The Education Department said Monday it has opened civil rights investigations into five states that banned school mask mandates to examine whether such policies place students with disabilities at heightened risk of severe illness through contracting Covid-19.

title: Joe Biden Bets on Cynicism
summary: Great presidents appeal to the better angels of our nature. Not this one.. Even as the last American warplanes lifted off from Kabul on Monday, there were those holding out hope that Joe Biden might yet reconsider letting the Taliban dictate the terms of our exit. These people profoundly misunderstand the president and the political equations driving his decisions.

title: Biden's Afghan Best-Case Scenario
summary: The president's party may squeak through 2022, but America's enemies won't let him go so easily.. As the Biden administration struggles to contain the fallout at home and abroad from the chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan, the president and his team still seem to hope the political pain will be short-lived, that over time the benefits of withdrawal will increasingly bolster their position.

title: Public Colleges Reach Across State Lines for a Tuition Windfall
summary: The 'student swap' creates a vicious circle that drives up higher-education costs and worsens the debt crisis.. America's public universities, designed to offer affordable college education to residents of their states, have been engaged in a "student swap." The best of these public universities (known as flagship schools in most state systems) have been enrolling more students from other states, in turn reducing admission of the students they were established to serve. The reason is simple: money. Out-of-state students pay substantially higher tuition. The result is college that is more expensive for many, but a society that is no better educated overall.

title: Biden's Vainglory Brings Abject Humiliation in Afghanistan
summary: 'America is back,' the president said in February, promising to 'live . . . by the power of our example.'. If you wanted to capture the geopolitical history of the 21st century so far in a single paragraph, you couldn't do much better than this:

title: Notable & Quotable: Jim Webb on Kabul
summary: 'We should look at the calamitous blunderings in Afghanistan as an opportunity to demand a true turning point.'. Former Sen. Jim Webb (D., Va.) writing for the National Interest, Aug. 29:

title: 'The Blue Age' Review: Dragging Anchor
summary: The U.S. Navy's dominance brought order to the oceans and fostered global trade. How much longer will that continue?. The U.S. Navy hasn't fought at sea in nearly 80 years. Few Americans were even alive when Ernest Evans, a Navy destroyer captain who died in the 1944 Battle of Leyte Gulf, said to his crew on the USS Johnston: "This is going to be a fighting ship. I intend to go in harm's way"-a line now famous in the Navy. The public has grown accustomed to peace, not fighting, on the seas.

title: SEC Sanctions Brokerages Over Email Break-Ins
summary: The enforcement actions are the latest in a push by regulators to get brokerages and money managers to better protect their clients' personal information. Securities regulators on Monday sanctioned three financial advisory firms over email account break-ins that exposed the personal information of thousands of customers.

title: Covid-19 Booster Shots Get Support From Expert Panel
summary: The panel, which advises the CDC, says health-care workers and nursing-home residents should get the extra doses first. Health experts advising the U.S. government on vaccines expressed initial support for giving booster shots to people vaccinated against Covid-19, starting with healthcare workers, nursing-home residents and others immunized earliest.

title: Supreme Court Asked to Intervene on Texas Six-Week Abortion Ban
summary: State's so-called fetal-heartbeat law is set to go into effect this week. WASHINGTON-Abortion providers filed an emergency request with the Supreme Court on Monday seeking to prevent a Texas law that bans the procedure after approximately six weeks of pregnancy from going into effect.

title: Support.com Stock More Than Triples in a Week, in a Squeeze Play
summary: Retail traders have helped push the technical-support company's stock up more than 1,500% in 2021. Individual investors have found their next short-squeeze target in little-known software company Support.com Inc.

title: Afghan Translator Had a Golden Ticket Out. He Never Made It.
summary: Bomb detonated at Kabul airport as Obaidullah Amin neared checkpoint, family in tow, guided by texts from Americans. Obaidullah Amin made his way last week to the Kabul airport with his wife, Maryam, and their two children, joining thousands of other Afghans desperate to board a plane to safety.

title: 'Kinds of Love' by Renee Rosnes Review: Finding the Beat of the Pandemic
summary: The jazz pianist's new album was conceived during the Covid-19 lockdown, when she was stuck at home instead of touring globally..

title: Scam Callers Still Dialing for Dollars
summary: A new technology designed to stem robocallers might not do much to cut down on volume. You don't need the cunning of a secret agent to figure out why "Rachel from dealer services" calls about your warranty three times a day but doesn't know what kind of car you drive. Ditto for the recorded message promising to lower your power bill, that rate offer from "VisaMastercard" or those notices that your Social Security number has been "suspended."

title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Set Records Again
summary: Oil climbed, extending a rally that began last week ahead of Hurricane Ida. The S&P 500 notched its 53rd record close of the year Monday as technology stocks lifted major indexes.

title: How Could Burning Man Get Weirder? When It's in Your Living Room.
summary: Resume Subscription. Nate Morris has traveled halfway around the world three times to dance with strangers and DJ a party from a bus decorated like a giant sheep at the annual Burning Man event. This year he's trying to replicate the same experience on a virtual reality headset in his apartment in Sydney, Australia.

title: U.S. Investigates Kabul Airstrike; Family Members Say 10 Civilians Killed
summary: Resume Subscription. The Pentagon pledged a transparent investigation of an airstrike in Kabul on Sunday that it said was aimed at foiling an attack by Islamic State militants on the Afghan capital's airport.

title: Home Flipping Becomes Virtual Reality
summary: IBuyer investors must ask whether scalability and sustainability are mutually exclusive-and, if so, which is more important. You can now sell your home online as quickly as you can sell a pair of shoes on eBay or Poshmark. But what is the return policy?

title: Top Pair (Tuesday Crossword, August 31)
Software Developer Veritran Secures Growth Investment From Trivest
summary: Deal values the Buenos Aires-based fintech software provider at $225 million. Veritran Inc., a Buenos Aires-based financial technology provider focused on mobile and digital banking, has secured a growth investment that values the company at some $225 million, according to a person familiar with the transaction.

title: 'Donda' by Kanye West: Begging for Brevity
summary: Features from big names can't save the superstar's garrulous new album.

title: How Mixing Hurricanes With Low Rates Impacts Insurers
summary: Reinsurers may be limited in how much they can use pricing to protect themselves from losses. Hurricane Ida is certainly going to be a big insurance event. What that means for investors has a lot to do with interest rates, too.

title: People Biden Didn't Forget
summary: The President takes care of a key constituency.. People could write books detailing all the operational issues President Joe Biden neglected in the course of his chaotic exit from Afghanistan, and no doubt many will. But while poor souls who helped America and even some U.S citizens may be left to the horrors of Kabul, the President hasn't forgotten to make Washington a happier place.

title: Russia and China Eye a Retreating U.S.
summary: Beijing will push for more sway in Pakistan; Moscow will try in Central Asia's former Soviet republics.. America's retreat from Afghanistan is ending tragically-and that has sweeping strategic implications. One major misjudgment underlying the "ending endless wars" mantra was that withdrawing affected only Afghanistan. To the contrary, the departure constitutes a major, and deeply regrettable, U.S. strategic realignment. China and Russia, our main global adversaries, are already seeking to reap advantages.

title: Trudeau Suddenly Faces a Real Challenge
summary: He thought a new election would yield a majority. Now the Conservatives lead.. Toronto

title: Willis Towers Watson Names New CFO as It Rebuilds Leadership Team
summary: The insurance broker is working to outline its strategy after its merger with Aon fell apart. Willis Towers Watson PLC rehired a former executive to be its finance chief as the insurance broker works to chart a new path after its merger with rival Aon PLC fell apart due to antitrust concerns.

title: The Real Problems of Living in a Virtual World
summary: Facebook and other companies view the 'metaverse' as the next big thing, but user discretion is advised. Heard of the "metaverse" lately? It has been hard not to.

title: Catalent to Buy Supplement Maker Bettera Holdings for $1 Billion
summary: Deal would add high-growth gummy vitamins and supplements to the contract drug manufacturer's portfolio. Contract drug manufacturer Catalent Inc. said Monday that it has agreed to buy closely held Bettera Holdings LLC for $1 billion, the latest deal involving nutritional supplement companies.

title: Reaching the End of the Line in Afghanistan
summary: Were America's losses in vain?. Thank you, Nolan Peterson, for your op-ed "Afghans Developed a Taste for Freedom" (Aug. 27). As the mother of a Marine who spent time in Afghanistan, my overwhelming reaction to the debacle in Kabul is depthless sorrow for the families of the 13 Americans killed Thursday. But I've also been trying to make sense of the 20 years of sacrifices Americans have made for the Afghan people.

title: The Debt Ceiling Provides a Moment of Truth
summary: We are doomed if we permit Congress to fudge the math without ever confessing, and to spend without ever being held to account.. The problem with Alan S. Blinder's argument for the Gephardt Rule ("A Simple Rule Could End Debt-Ceiling Shenanigans," op-ed, Aug. 24) is that the budget bills he would rely on are themselves packed with shenanigans. Falsified assumptions and accounting gimmicks are used to conceal the true costs.

title: What Proponents of Legal Marijuana Forget to Mention
summary: There exists clear medical evidence of the harms of increasing access to weed.. The letter supporting marijuana legalization from Paul Armentano of the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws ("Decriminalizing Marijuana Doesn't Address the Problem," Aug. 27) completely ignores the medical consequences, suffered throughout the nation, of enhancing access to marijuana.

title: Virginia's 'Moderate' Cannon Fodder for Pelosi
summary: Rep. Abigail Spanberger falls in line and votes like nearly every other Democrat.. Regarding Kimberley A. Strassel's "Pelosi's Cannon Fodder" (Potomac Watch, Aug. 27): I am represented by a Democratic moderate, Abigail Spanberger. I might as well be represented by Speaker Nancy Pelosi directly. As far as I can tell, Rep. Spanberger has not been successful in moderating the bills that Mrs. Pelosi brings to the House floor, and in the end she falls in line and votes like nearly every other Democrat. Out of 259 votes this year, she has voted against her party only 11 times, and none of these were against final passage of a bill.

title: China's Hostage-Taking Is Not in the Olympic Spirit
summary: Anyone fancy a trip to Beijing?. "Huawei and China's Canadian Hostages" (Review & Outlook, Aug. 12) makes you wonder if going to Beijing for the 2022 Winter Olympics in February is a good idea.

title: EU Recommends Halting Nonessential Travel From U.S.
summary: In decision, EU says member states can continue allowing in vaccinated travelers if they choose to. BRUSSELS-The European Union recommended halting nonessential travel from the U.S. because of the rise of Covid-19 cases, diplomats said Monday, ending a summer-vacation reprieve for American tourists.

title: New Office to Treat Climate Change as Public-Health Issue
summary: New federal office is likely to face pushback over actions that target health industry. The Department of Health and Human Services has launched an office that will treat climate change as a public-health issue, designed to address what the White House says are health risks, including those that disproportionately affect poor and minority communities.

title: Hurricane Ida: Did New Orleans's Flood System Work?
summary: Ida is the biggest test yet of the storm risk-reduction system that was installed after Hurricane Katrina. Ida made landfall near New Orleans Sunday as a Category 4 hurricane, bringing fierce winds, heavy rains and dangerous storm surges. Ida is presenting the biggest test yet of the storm risk-reduction system that was installed in the New Orleans metro area after Hurricane Katrina.

title: Children Fare Well With Health After Severe Post-Covid-19 Condition, Study Finds
summary: Study, which focused on a rare inflammatory complication, released as concerns grow over vulnerability of children to Delta variant. Most children admitted to intensive care with a serious inflammatory complication after getting Covid-19 didn't have serious lingering issues a year later, according to a study of data collected from hospitals across the U.K.

title: Cloudera to Appoint New CFO After Buyout Deal
summary: KKR and CD&R have agreed to take Cloudera private in a $5.3 billion deal. Cloudera Inc. said Jim Frankola, the finance chief, will transition to the newly created role of strategic adviser after the company closes its go-private transaction with private-equity firms KKR & Co. and Clayton Dubilier & Rice LLC.

title: Chinese Tech Giant Meituan Logs Another Loss Despite Sales Jump
summary: Under pressure amid crackdown, CEO says 'fine-tuning' of business will be long-term positive. Chinese food-delivery giant Meituan reported another big jump in quarterly revenue, as more people turned to it to order meals and groceries, but the company remained unprofitable for a third consecutive quarter as it spent heavily to expand.

title: New Afghanistan Worry Same as Old Afghanistan Worry
summary: Taliban likely want to keep out Islamic State, but it's unclear if they're able to. As last week drew to a close, a senior State Department official was asked whether Afghanistan's new Taliban rulers have the willingness and the capability to stop more terror strikes by the Islamic State radicals who had just killed 13 American servicemen and women at the Kabul airport. The official replied: "The intent is there. I think the capacity is in question."

title: Hurricane Ida: What to Know About the Storm and Its Damage
summary: Ida strikes New Orleans as a Category 4 hurricane on 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. Hurricane Ida made landfall near New Orleans at midday Sunday, bringing winds of 150 miles an hour, lashing rain and life-threatening storm surges on the 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina.

title: Kids Head Back to School-and Bring Covid-19's Mental-Health Scars With Them
summary: Resume Subscription. MONTEREY PARK, Calif.-JR Dzubak was breaking up a fistfight between a group of high-school boys in July when he had a moment of doubt. What if he wasn't doing enough?

title: Disney Held Unsuccessful Mediation Talks With Alleged Sexual-Assault Victims
summary: Claims surfaced in lawsuit last week against former top producer Michael Corn, who denies the allegations; ABC is also a defendant. Walt Disney Co. and its ABC unit held unsuccessful mediation talks in June with the two women who have alleged they were sexually assaulted by a former ABC News executive, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: The Youngest King of Mountain Biking Is Now the Oldest, Too
summary: Nino Schurter was 22 when he won his first world title. Now he's won his ninth at age 35. A conversation with the Swiss legend about his longevity, the sport's future-and his thoughts on a rising U.S. team.. "It was really emotional," Nino Schurter admitted.

title: Support.com, Zoom, Hill-Rom: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Wall Street indexes are on track to hover near their records at the open. U.S. stock futures are little changed Monday after the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite reached record closes. Here's what we're watching ahead of the start to this week's trading:

title: Haiti Quake Turned Baptism Celebration Into Tragedy
summary: Towns like Les Anglais are still largely cut off, and survivors sleep on the streets awaiting aid. It was supposed to be a joyous Saturday morning in the seaside Haitian farming village of Les Anglais, where 200 children dressed in white began to gather with their families at the Immaculate Conception Parish church for their baptism.

title: The 15 Best New Songs of August
summary: Your end-of-summer playlist, just in time for Labor Day weekend: all the best new pop releases of the month.. It has been more than two years since Lizzo's singles "Truth Hurts" and "Good As Hell" and her full-length album, Cuz I Love You, went viral. Since then, the boisterous pop performer has become a topic of all kinds of speculation, from gossip about her dating life to comments on her body. "All the rumors are true," Lizzo boasts on her playful new single, which features fellow outspoken rapper Cardi B.

title: The Surprising Way Nike CEO John Donahoe Starts His Day
summary: The Monday-morning routine of Nike's president and CEO: 33 ounces of water, a workout and a burgeoning gratitude practice.. Early in his career, Nike President and CEO John Donahoe heard a speaker at a Bain & Company training program make an observation that immediately clicked with him: Elite athletes tend to view getting help as a sign of strength. "He was talking about [how] Michael Jordan didn't only have Phil Jackson as his bench coach, but he had a personal chef; he had a psychological coach," says Donahoe, 61. "And he said, 'You people in business, you act like getting help is a sign of weakness. You act like you have all the answers. If you want to perform at a world-class level, you've got to feel comfortable consuming help.' " In the decades since, Donahoe has worked with multiple leadership coaches; seen his therapist, Jill Mellick, for 30 years; and established his own board of personal directors-trusted friends he turns to for advice.

title: Covid-19 Surge in Asia Threatens Manufacture of Ceramic Bits in iPhones and PlayStations
summary: Top maker of tiny critical component shuts factory for week, highlighting role of the 'rice' of electronics. Hidden inside the newest smartphones are more than a thousand tiny bits of ceramic to control the flow of electricity. Inside an electric vehicle, there are more than 10,000.

title: The Slumping Mets Are Booing Their Own Fans...for Booing Them
summary: Stars like Javier Báez and Francisco Lindor on Sunday responded to boos at Citi Field by giving their critics a thumbs-down. Those critics have included Mets owner Steve Cohen.. New York Mets fans have every reason to be upset about how their team is performing. And, this being New York, they're not shy about expressing it. The problem is that the fans' being mad at the players has only made the players mad at the fans, who are now doubly mad. For a franchise long trapped in self-parody, this makes perfect sense.

title: GameStop Stock Rally Passes by Some Previous Winners
summary: A number of exchange-traded funds that benefited from the early-year surge in meme stocks have since backed away. Many exchange-traded funds that scored big on the meme-stock craze earlier this year are missing out on large gains this time around.

title: How the 'Right to Repair' Might Save Your Gadgets-and Save You Money
summary: New legislation aims to provide more options for fixing our broken gadgets. A journey to fix two MacBooks illustrates the repair restrictions put in place by Apple and other big tech companies.. Name: MacBook Pro.

title: China's Electric-Vehicle Ambitions Are No Pipe Dream
summary: Chinese EV makers are starting to compete on technology and product design. Foreign competitors need to watch their backs.. Chinese electric-vehicle sales are shifting back into high gear after a period of stagnant growth. Its homegrown EV makers are also turning into more formidable competitors: After struggling for decades to match foreign expertise in the internal combustion engine, China has a real chance to put foreign brands on the back foot in the electric era.

title: Krispy Kreme Focuses on Reducing Debt, Delivering Fresher Doughnuts
summary: The company went public again in July after it bought out franchisees. Doughnut maker Krispy Kreme Inc. is focusing on paying down debt and delivering fresher pastries after returning to the public markets this summer.

title: Unfinished Tractors, Pickup Trucks Pile Up as Components Run Short
summary: Supply-chain problems cause order backlogs, cutting into sales volumes for companies like Cleveland-Cliffs, Honeywell and Illinois Tool Works. Manufacturers are stacking up unfinished goods on factory floors and parking incomplete vehicles in airport parking lots while waiting for missing parts, made scarce by supply-chain problems.

title: Ida Batters Louisiana, Leaving New Orleans Without Power
summary: Storm is region's most severe since Hurricane Katrina; first death is reported. NEW ORLEANS-Hurricane Ida made landfall on Sunday and battered this city and much of southeast Louisiana, knocking out power, downing trees and causing havoc as the region's most severe storm since Hurricane Katrina exactly 16 years earlier.

title: Direct Listings Have Paid Off for Investors So Far
summary: Warby Parker and other tech companies show direct listings are here to stay as such stocks have been a solid bet. Eyewear maker Warby Parker Inc. last week became the latest company to file paperwork with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a direct listing, illustrating the staying power of the alternative path to public markets for companies that don't need to raise money.

title: United Jets With Engines in Denver Incident May Not Fly Until Next Year
summary: Federal regulators are weighing additional safeguards for some of the airline's Boeing 777s after a February engine incident over Colorado. Dozens of United Airlines Holdings Inc. jets like the one that lost an engine cover over Colorado in February aren't expected to fly until early next year, as federal regulators weigh additional safeguards, people briefed on the matter said.

title: Uzbekistan Tells U.S. That Afghan Pilots, Families Can't Stay
summary: An Afghan pilot's U.S. relatives seek help, as U.S.-trained airmen are caught in a diplomatic tussle. WASHINGTON-Facing Taliban pressure, Uzbekistan has warned the U.S. that a group of highly trained Afghan pilots who fled there two weeks ago aboard Afghan Air Force helicopters and airplanes face expulsion from the country, officials say.

title: Yemen Victims Push for War Crimes Investigation
summary: Petition to the International Criminal Court aims to uncover abuses in the bloody civil war as the U.S. attempts to exit the conflict. Lawyers for survivors and families of people killed in Yemen's civil war have filed evidence to the International Criminal Court in an attempt to trigger a formal investigation into alleged war crimes by military forces led by Saudi Arabia and backed by the U.S.

title: Aluminum Hits Decade Highs on Soaring Demand, Snarled Supply
summary: Buyers in the U.S. and Europe struggle to get their hands on the metal thanks to container shortages and shipping delays. Aluminum prices are reaching 10-year highs, as buyers far from storage centers in Asia compete to line up shipments for use in beverage cans, airplanes and construction.

title: Chinese Bad-Debt Manager Huarong Confirms $16 Billion Annual Loss
summary: Firm says it has learned a harsh lesson after taking huge writedowns. China's top manager of distressed assets, China Huarong Asset Management Co., confirmed it made a net loss of roughly $16 billion last year, and warned investors that it fell short of regulatory requirements on financial strength.

title: These Millennials Are Dumping Their Jobs to Plot New Careers
summary: With several years in the workforce and some savings, some young professionals take an early career break to reassess and chart a different path. They launched careers in the years after the 2007-09 recession and only recently hit their stride in earning power. Now some young professionals are quitting their jobs with no Plan B.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: R&B (Monday Crossword, August 30)
U.S. Targets Suspected Suicide Bombers in Kabul Drone Strike
summary: The Biden administration said it remained committed to Afghanistan as the 20-year war winds down. WASHINGTON-The U.S. said it launched a drone strike targeting suspected suicide bombers near the Kabul airport Sunday as America's 20-year war in Afghanistan wound down to its final hours.

title: Trapped in Afghanistan, Rescued by Volunteers: How a Handful of Americans Freed 5,000 Afghans
summary: Resume Subscription. Zach Van Meter, a private-equity investor from Naples, Fla., phoned the government of Somaliland last week, asking if it would host thousands of Afghan refugees.
